Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2009 02:13AM JCinAZ wrote: Before my core biopsy my surgeon told me she was 90% certain this would turn out to be benign.  It came back ADH, so yes benign, just a higher risk catatory.  I had an excisional biopsy to double check there wasn't anthing else and that came back just more of the same.  So yes in my case no cancer.  having an mri done, but again she's confident there won't be any surprises.  best of luck to you.
Posts.Title: HAS ANYONE GETTING A BIOPS BEEN GIVEN A PERCENTAGE? juliarose sheila888

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 02:13PM JCinAZ wrote: I'm so glad you posted this.  I have my wire guided excisional biopsy on Thursday and i've been wondering the same thing.  I'm also wondering about recovery time.  My stereo biopsy was a piece of cake.  It was done first thing in the morning and i went straight to work from the doctors.  I'm hoping since my body handled that so easily, that i'll have a quick recovery from Thursday's procedure.  We'll see...  Good luck on Monday.

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2009 11:32AM JCinAZ wrote: Hey Julie, It's tomorrow... however that would totally be like me to just forget so thanks for keep ing me in line.  But it's definately tomorrow at 5:45am.  Everyone here has been so generous with information, that i'm feeling pretty relaxed about the whole thing.  Now i'm just hoping i don't over sleep.
Posts.Title: does the wire hurt in an excisional biopsy?? debnyc JCinAZ

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2009 06:49AM JCinAZ wrote: Well that wasn't so bad at all.  my appt was early, 5:45 am.  I headed the advice about dehydration and the iv and drank tons of water right up until i went to bed.  (maybe too much had to get up twice in the middle of the night to pee.)  i got there and did my paperwork and they took me right back.  my hubby was allowed to come with me.  I put on hospital gown and paper booties they took my vitals and started my iv without any problems.  they even gave gave me a local before they put the bigger iv needle in.  i saw my surgeon and the radiolgist.  ask my questions, answered theirs...  Then they took me back for the wire.  I had to go in a wheel chair.  It was exactly like my stereo biopsy.  same table and everything.  but they numbed me and i didn't feel a thing.  Ivtwoqlt description of the wire like a guitar string is dead on.  i'm a really tactile person and couldn't resist touching it before they taped it down.  and the radiology tech said "don't worry, you get all the tucson stations now."  i said, "oh crap, i was hoping for satallite."  they took two more pictures with the wire in place and wheeled me back to my hubby.  I got on my bed, they put that lovely cap on me and took me back to the OR.  i barely had time to give my hubby a kiss.  I remember getting on the OR table and them putting my arms on those boards and that's it.  i woke up in recovery, lifted up the front of my gown to take a peek. they put one of those post op bras one me.  I told nurse, "hmmm pretty sexy.  could i have one in black too."  She said, "well i guess you're feeling fine." and got me my hubby a some juice. i'm feeling pretty good.  they gave me pain meds but haven't needed them.  i have the day off, but if i had to go in it wouldn't be a problem.  don't get me wrong, i'm sore, just not show stopping sore.  well i hope this helps anyone else going through this.  I get my results on tuesday so i'm keeping my fingers crossed until then.
Posts.Title: does the wire hurt in an excisional biopsy?? debnyc JCinAZ

Posts.Content: JCinAZ wrote: I originaly posted this in the not diagnosed forum, but I've been camping here a lot too and thought it couldn't hurt to post here too.  This sure is a bunch of great people here. I'm 36 yrs old.  They found microcalcifcations during a mammo.  I had a core biopsy done 2 weeks ago. The pathology reports says, "Atypical Ductal Hyperplasia, Columnar Cell and Micropapillary changes with microcalcification."  I have an excisional biopsy scheduled for the 26th.  So many women her seems so well informed.  I was hoping someone could explain my report in plain english.  and if anyone has similar results, what were your biopsy results.  The doctor was reluctant to give me much more info other than, we'll cross that bridge if or when we come to it. There's tons of information on the internet, but so much of it is so clinical.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: how worried should i be? JCinAZ leaf

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2009 06:50PM JCinAZ wrote: It really does seem like this board is filled with lots of positive supportive people.  I haven't told any of our family about any of this yet,other than hubby and our two teenagers.  I wouldn't have told the kids yet except that when the dr told me about restrictions aftere the excisional biopsy I thought I'm going to need their help with the 3 yr old so it was time.  My mother in law is living this right now. She just finished her chemo and had a real hard time wtih it.  So I just don't want to stress her out needlessly.  And all our family is out of state anyway and my husband travels a lot, so i'm feeling pretty isolated.  I've been lurking around here for a few days and saw how quick people are to respond, so I thought I'd put myself out there.  It's just nice to hear from people who know what i'm going through.
Posts.Title: how worried should i be? JCinAZ JCinAZ
